Constructor Detail

CircuitManager

public CircuitManager(RedstoneChips plugin)
Method Detail

onBlockRedstoneChange

public void onBlockRedstoneChange(org.bukkit.block.Block b,
                                  int newCurrent,
                                  int oldCurrent)
Redstone change event handler. Checks if this event reports an input change in any circuit's input pins. When the new redstone state is different than the current one, the input pin is updated and the circuit is notified.

Parameters:
e - A redstone change event.

checkForCircuit

public int checkForCircuit(ScanParameters params,
                           org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender)
Scans a chip starting at params.signBlock, debug level set to 0.

Parameters:
params - An initialized ScanParameters object.
sender - The circuit activator
Returns:
The new chip id or -1 if a chip was not found or -2 if an error occurred.

checkForCircuit

public int checkForCircuit(ScanParameters params,
                           org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                           int debugLevel)
Scans a chip starting at params.signBlock.

Parameters:
params - An initialized ScanParameters object.
sender - The circuit activator.
debugLevel - Scanning debug level. 0 - no debug messages.
Returns:
The new chip id or -1 if a chip was not found or -2 if an error occurred.

activateCircuit

public int activateCircuit(Circuit c,
                           org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                           int id)
Activates an already scanned circuit.

Parameters:
c - The circuit to activate
sender - The activator.
id - The desired circuit id. When less than 0, a new id is generated.
Returns:
The circuit's id or -2 if an error occurred.

checkCircuitDestroyed

public boolean checkCircuitDestroyed(org.bukkit.block.Block b,
                                     org.bukkit.command.CommandSender s)
Checks whether the block b is part of a circuit and if so deactivates the circuit.

Parameters:
b - The block that was broken.
s - The breaker. Can be null.

destroyCircuit

public boolean destroyCircuit(Circuit destroyed,
                              org.bukkit.command.CommandSender destroyer,
                              boolean destroyBlocks)
Deactivates the specified circuit, possibly changing all of its structure blocks into air.

Parameters:
destroyed - The circuit that was destroyed.
destroyer - The circuit's destroyer.
destroyBlocks - True if the circuit's blocks should turn into air.
Returns:
true if successful.

resetCircuit

public boolean resetCircuit(Circuit c,
                            org.bukkit.command.CommandSender reseter)
Resets a circuit. First the circuit is destroyed and then reactivated. Any listeners of the circuit are copied over to the new circuit.

Parameters:
c - The circuit to reset.
reseter - The reseter.
Returns:
true if the circuit was reactivated.

updateOnChunkLoad

public void updateOnChunkLoad(ChunkLocation chunk)
Called on every chunk load event. Finds any circuits in the loaded chunk and calls their .circuitChunkLoaded() method.

Parameters:
chunk - The loaded chunk.

checkCircuitsIntegrity

public void checkCircuitsIntegrity(org.bukkit.World world)
Check each active circuit to see if all of its blocks are in place. See Circuit.checkIntegrity(). Any unloaded circuit chunks are first loaded and then unloaded after the check is over.

findCircuitChunks

public ChunkLocation[] findCircuitChunks(Circuit c)
Finds the circuit's chunks according to its activation block, output power blocks, input power blocks and interface blocks.

Parameters:
c - The circuit to check.
Returns:
All chunks used by this circuit.

shutdownAllCircuits

public void shutdownAllCircuits()
Calls Circuit.circuitShutdown on every activated circuit.

getCircuits

public HashMap<Integer,Circuit> getCircuits()
Returns:
a map of all active circuits. The map keys are circuit ids.

getCircuits

public HashMap<Integer,Circuit> getCircuits(org.bukkit.World world)
Returns:
a map of all active circuits in the specified world. The map keys are circuit ids.

getCircuitByStructureBlock

public Circuit getCircuitByStructureBlock(org.bukkit.Location structureBlock)
Parameters:
structureBlock - Any block that belongs to a chip.
Returns:
The circuit that the block belongs to or null if a circuit was not found.

getCircuitByActivationBlock

public Circuit getCircuitByActivationBlock(org.bukkit.Location activationBlock)
Parameters:
activationBlock - An activation sign of a chip.
Returns:
The circuit that uses this activation sign or null if a circuit was not found.

getOutputPin

public OutputPin getOutputPin(org.bukkit.Location outputBlock)
Parameters:
outputBlock - An output block of a chip.
Returns:
The output pin represented by this block or null if none was found.

getInputPin

public InputPin getInputPin(org.bukkit.Location inputBlock)
Parameters:
inputBlock - An input block of a chip.
Returns:
The input pin represented by this block or null if none was found.

getInputPinBySource

public List<InputPin> getInputPinBySource(org.bukkit.Location sourceBlock)
Parameters:
sourceBlock - A signal source block surrounding an input block.
Returns:
A list of input pins that can receive a signal from this block or null if none was found.

getOutputPinByOutputBlock

public List<OutputPin> getOutputPinByOutputBlock(org.bukkit.Location outputBlock)
Parameters:
outputBlock - A block that receives signal from an output pin.
Returns:
A list of output pins that can change the state of the output block or null if none was found.

getCircuitById

public Circuit getCircuitById(String id)
Parameters:
id - A chip id number of name.
Returns:
The chip that has this id or null if none was found.

unloadWorldChips

public void unloadWorldChips(org.bukkit.World unloadedWorld)
Unloads all chip in the specified world.

Parameters:
unloadedWorld -

generateId

public int generateId()
Generates a circuit id.

Returns:
a new unused circuit id.

workOnChunk

public void workOnChunk(ChunkLocation chunk)
Mark a chunk as a processed chunk. While marked the chunk would not be allowed to unload. Call releaseChunk(chunk) to release it.

Parameters:
chunk - The chunk to keep alive.

releaseChunk

public void releaseChunk(ChunkLocation chunk)
Release a used chunk and allow it to unload.

Parameters:
chunk - The chunk to release

isProcessingChunk

public boolean isProcessingChunk(ChunkLocation chunk)
Parameters:
chunk - The chunk to test.
Returns:
true if the chunk was loaded, or is kept loaded, for processing.
